paper_abstract: Let p(1), p(2), p(3) be three distinct points in the plane, and, for i = 1,2,3, let C-i be a family of n unit circles that pass through p(i). We address a conjecture made by Sz,kely, and show that the number of points incident to a circle of each family isO(n(11/6) , improving an earlier bound for this problem due to Elekes et al. (Comb Probab Comput 18:691-705, 2009). The problem is a special instance of a more general problem studied by Elekes and Szab (Combinatorica 32:537-571, 2012) [and by Elekes and Rnyai (J Comb Theory Ser A 89:1-20, 2000)].
paper_title: On Triple Intersections of Three Families of Unit Circles
